A frequent side effect of these medications is irritation of the stomach lining, which can cause gastritis or a general stomach ache. This hypothesis suggests the stomach ache may be a direct result of medication taken to manage the elbow and joint pain, providing a clear link between the two symptoms.
predictions.care: If taking over-the-counter pain relievers, always take them with food and a full glass of water. Avoid lying down for 15-30 minutes after taking them.
predictions.doctor_advice: Consult a doctor or pharmacist before continuing NSAID use if you have stomach pain. Seek immediate medical attention if the stomach pain is severe, or if you notice blood in your vomit or dark, tarry stools. A primary care physician or a gastroenterologist can help manage these symptoms.
